00027 /* Fibonacci heaps are somewhat complex, but, there's an article in
00028    DDJ that explains them pretty well:
00029 
00030    http://www.ddj.com/articles/1997/9701/9701o/9701o.htm?topic=algoritms
00031 
00032    Introduction to algorithms by Corman and Rivest also goes over them.
00033 
00034    The original paper that introduced them is "Fibonacci heaps and their
00035    uses in improved network optimization algorithms" by Tarjan and
00036    Fredman (JACM 34(3), July 1987).
00037 
00038    Amortized and real worst case time for operations:
00039 
00040    ExtractMin: O(lg n) amortized. O(n) worst case.
00041    DecreaseKey: O(1) amortized.  O(lg n) worst case.
00042    Insert: O(2) amortized. O(1) actual.
00043    Union: O(1) amortized. O(1) actual.  */
00044 
00045 #ifndef FIBHEAP_H
00046 #define FIBHEAP_H
00047 
00048 #include "system.h"
00049 #include <inttypes.h>
00050 #include "pthread-wrapper.h"
00051 #include "alloc-pool.h"
00052 
00054 typedef uint32_t fibheapkey_t;
00055 #define FIBHEAPKEY_MIN 0
00056 #define FIBHEAPKEY_MAX ((fibheapkey_t) -1)
00057 
00059 typedef struct fibnode_def
00060 {
00061   struct fibnode_def *parent;
00062   struct fibnode_def *child;
00063   struct fibnode_def *left;
00064   struct fibnode_def *right;
00065   fibheapkey_t key;
00066   void *data;
00067   unsigned int degree : 31;
00068   unsigned int mark : 1;
00069 } *fibnode;
00070 
00072 typedef struct fibheap_def
00073 {
00074   unsigned int nodes;
00075   struct fibnode_def *min;
00076   struct fibnode_def *root;
00077   pthread_mutex_t *mutex;
00078   alloc_pool pool;
00079 } *fibheap;
00080 
00083 typedef int (*fibheap_foreach_fn) (void *node_data, void *data);
00084 
00085 extern fibheap fibheap_new (unsigned int block_size, pthread_mutex_t *mutex);
00086 extern fibnode fibheap_insert (fibheap, fibheapkey_t, void *);
00087 extern unsigned int fibheap_size (fibheap);
00088 extern fibheapkey_t fibheap_min_key (fibheap);
00089 extern fibnode fibheap_replace_key (fibheap, fibnode, fibheapkey_t);
00090 extern void *fibheap_extract_min (fibheap);
00091 extern void *fibheap_min (fibheap);
00092 extern void *fibheap_delete_node (fibheap, fibnode);
00093 extern void fibheap_delete (fibheap);
00094 extern fibheap fibheap_union (fibheap, fibheap);
00095 extern int fibheap_foreach (fibheap heap, fibheap_foreach_fn fn, void *data);
00096 
00097 #endif
